What Can You Do With Services?

Help us improve this page

Here are the things you can do with services:

Interact with a service:

A client can interact with a service; for example, to retrieve customer information or to change a customer's address.

  • Call a service using a service interface. This is a simple PHP call using Magento 2's dependency injection. For more information, see How a Client Uses a Service.
  • Make a web services call using either REST or SOAP. For more information, see How a Client Uses a Service.
Customize or change the behavior of a service:

As a developer, you can change the behavior of a service (for example, get shipping prices when a customer checks out in the storefront).

  • Create a plug-in. Plug-ins take the place of the event-observer system in earlier versions of Magento. For more information, see the plug-in topic on the Magento wiki.
  • Replace the service's interface (this functionality is not currently available).
Market an extension to Magento 2 merchants:

Create a moduleApplication written in PHP that performs business functions. (A module is sometimes referred to as a package or an extension)., which is easier than it was in earlier Magento versions and package the module as an extensionA module that is marketed to other Magento merchants on Magento Connect. (This is currently not available for Magento 2.).

Currently, you cannot create an extension for Magento 2 modules. You can, however, create an integrationSet of properties that enable Magento to share authorized objects with a third-party application.. For more information, see What is an Integration?.
